original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady in mid-day trade, rupee at 321/321.30 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady in the mid-day trade on Wednesday as results of a bill auction is awaited, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 27.30/28.00 percent steady from 27.60/28.00 percent from a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 25.90/26.00 percent, steady from 25.85/26.00 percent.
The one year bill was quoted at 22.00/30 percent, unchanged from the last close.
The rupee quoted at 321/30 to the US dollar in the spot market slightly depreciated from Tuesday’s close at 320.30/321.30 rupees. (Colombo/April19/2023)
